174.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the troops involved in the campaign to capture Ukraine's Luhansk region should "absolutely rest and recover their military preparedness". Putin called on forces on other fronts to pursue their aims according to "previously approved plans". Russia's capture of Luhansk is its last victory on our territory, Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych said.

175.title: We have chance to better our CWG record after Thomas Cup win: Gopichand
175.article_body: Indian badminton's chief national coach Pullela Gopichand has said that India's badminton contingent for this month's Commonwealth Games has a "chance" to improve its medal tally. "Last time [in 2018] we won two gold medals...But looking [at win] at the Thomas Cup, I'm sure we'll have a chance to better our records in the men's singles and doubles," he said.

176.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion will be done soon: Dy CM Fadnavis
176.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, a day after the Eknath Shinde-led state government won the trust vote in the Assembly, said the state cabinet will be expanded soon. "Let us breathe properly. Devendra Fadnavis and I will sit and discuss cabinet portfolios and their allocation," said CM Shinde after winning the trust vote on Monday.

177.title: Single, low tax rate will reduce burden on poor people: Rahul
177.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the government over GST rates and asserted that a low tax rate will help reduce the burden on the poor and the middle class. "GST on Health Insurance: 18%. GST on Hospital Room: 5%. GST on Diamonds: 1.5%. 'Gabbar Singh Tax' is a painful reminder of who the PM cares for," he said.

178.title: Nupur Sharma row a conspiracy by BJP to further its divisive policy: Mamata
178.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday alleged that the "Nupur Sharma controversy was a conspiracy by the BJP to further its divisive policy". "Why was she not arrested? Arrest her because you cannot play with fire," Mamata added. She said that the country's global image has been affected due to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Mohammed.

179.title: Gurugram-based ENSUREDIT raises $4.2 mn in pre-Series A funding
179.article_body: Gurugram-based insurtech firm ï»¿ENSUREDITï»¿ has raised $4.2 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by US-based Cover Genius. The funding also saw participation from investors such as 9Unicorns, NexStep Discovery, CP Ventures, Venture Catalysts and IPV. ENSUREDIT focuses on working closely with insurance distributors to enhance their sales force acquisition and productivity.

180.title: World's largest waterlily species discovered in Kew Gardens
180.article_body: Scientists have discovered the world's largest waterlily belonging to the genus Victoria at Kew Gardens. Named V boliviana, in honour of Bolivian partners in the research, leaves of the newly discovered waterlily species grow up to three metres. It has flowers which turn from white to pink and bear spiny petioles. It's one of the world's botanical wonders, scientists said.

181.title: 2 families stake claim on man's dead body in UP, DNA profiling process begins
181.article_body: The dead body of a man who was allegedly run over by a train in Uttar Pradesh was exhumed and the DNA profiling procedure was started after two families staked claim on the body. "Samples are being sent to the forensic laboratory. The next course of action will be decided on basis of the laboratory report," Sirathu Sub-Divisional Magistrate said.

182.title: 16-ft long wall collapses in Thane amid rains, 17 families relocated
182.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Thane, a 16-feet long security wall collapsed at a chawl in the Mumbra area on Monday, making 17 families temporarily relocate from their houses. The affected persons were shifted to rescue shelter set up at a Thane Municipal Corporation school. India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Mumbai for the next five days.

183.title: Himachal records highest fatalities in road mishaps among 3 hill states
183.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has recorded the highest road fatalities among three northern hill states, including Jammu and Kashmir and Uttarakhand, official data reportedly said. Data said that Himachal records an average of three deaths per day and around 3,000 people lose their lives in road mishaps in Himachal Pradesh annually.

184.title: Life is definitely easier in the commentary box: Ravi Shastri
184.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri, who's currently commentating in the ongoing rescheduled fifth Test between India and England, has said life is "definitely easier in the commentary box". Shastri, however, also added, "To be honest, I have been richer by the experience (India coaching stint). The seven-year stint has been a huge experience for me."

185.title: Nearly 1,000 unknown microbes found trapped in Tibetan glaciers
185.article_body: Scientists have discovered nearly 1,000 new species of microbes in the frozen Tibetan Plateau. Almost 98% of these 968 bacteria species are yet unknown to science, some being over 15,000 years old. The study stated that when the glaciers melt, these microorganisms, possibly carrying novel virulence factors, could lead to local epidemics or pandemics in India and China.

186.title: Landslide in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area due to heavy rain, house damaged
186.article_body: A landslide incident was reported on Tuesday morning in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area in which a house was badly damaged amidst incessant rainfall in the city. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far. In the last 12 hours, Mumbai has recorded 95.81 mm of rain due to which areas are waterlogged and traffic movement has been affected.

187.title: India spread the field too soon, were almost fearful: Vaughan on Day 4
187.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India spread the field "too soon" on Day four of the fifth Test against England, adding that they were almost "fearful". "Once you spread the field, your good balls are going for singles," stated Vaughan. England need 119 runs to win the fifth Test with seven wickets in hand after being given a 378-run target.

188.title: China rejects NASA allegation that it is trying to take over moon
188.article_body: China rejected NASA chief Bill Nelson's allegation that it is trying to take over the moon. This comes after Nelson said, "We must be very concerned that China is landing on the moon and saying: 'It's ours now and you stay out'." A Chinese government spokesperson said the US has "constantly constructed a smear campaign against China'sâ€¦reasonable outer space endeavours".

189.title: Pic of England fan making racist gestures towards Indian fans in stands surfaces
189.article_body: A picture of an England fan making racist gestures towards Indian fans in the stands during the rescheduled fifth England-India Test at Edgbaston has surfaced online. "I witnessed this guy...He was horrific. We had to leave," an England fan tweeted on his picture. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has launched an investigation into the matter.

190.title: Why should you not be penalised: Govt in notice to Ola Electric, others over EV fires
190.article_body: The Centre has sent notices to Ola Electric, Pure EV and Okinawa asking them to explain why they should not be penalised for the recent electric scooter fires, some of them reportedly caused by battery failures. They have been given time till July-end to respond to the notices. The government has also formed two committees to probe the fire incidents.

191.title: 60-80 people wanted to kill him, 8 attempts made to kill him during polls: Sidhu's father
191.article_body: Balkaur Singh, father of late singer Sidhu Moosewala, has said that gangsters are running a parallel government in Punjab. He also said that 60-80 people were after Moosewala to kill him, adding, "Efforts were made at least eight more times during the elections to kill him." Singh said, "Government too left no stone unturned, withdrew his security, publicised it."

192.title: Robbers inspired by B'wood film pose as CBI, IT officials to raid Delhi house
192.article_body: Inspired by a Bollywood movie, a team of 15 robbers, posing as CBI, IT and anti-corruption branch officials, raided a businessman's house in Delhi's Shahdara on Sunday, police said. They held the family members hostage and seized their cellphones and ransacked the house, police added. The neighbours managed to overpower four robbers when they were trying to flee, police stated.

193.title: I've known Hrithik since I was 10, I love him from bottom of my heart: Zayed
193.article_body: Zayed Khan opened up about his bond with his former brother-in-law Hrithik Roshan and said, "I've known Hrithik since I was 10." He added that Hrithik is "one of the most generous and disciplined people" he has ever met. "I love him from...bottom of my heart...He has always been the kind of brother...I can speak my heart to," said Zayed.

194.title: Indian bowlers tried too hard, there was desperation: Zaheer on Day 4
194.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said the Indian bowlers went wrong on Day 4 of the fifth Test against England by trying "too hard", adding all of them were bowling with the mindset that they need to go after wickets. "There was desperation...and...they were trying too many things. They kept changing their line and lengths and paid the price," stated Zaheer.

195.title: Spinner's job in 4th innings is to win the game for the team: Swann on Jadeja
195.article_body: Ex-England spinner Graeme Swann has said India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's job on Day 4 of the ongoing Test against England was not to slow down scoring but to pick wickets. "Your job in the 4th innings, as a spinner, is to win the game for the team...You can't do that, bowling into a foothold without catchers," stated Swann.

196.title: Will work for the party again: Mithun Chakraborty in Kolkata
196.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Mithun Chakraborty announced his comeback in active politics before 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "I was inactive for some time because of health reasons. But I am fit now. So, I came to Kolkata today," he said. "I will work on specific assignments given to me by the party leadership, which I am unable to disclose now," he further added.

197.title: Man says Hyd police called shop number after he forgot to lock it, thanks them
197.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday shared a picture of a man's tweet in which he said that patrolling personnel of the Sulthan Bazar Police Station called his shop's number after he forgot to lock it. The man thanked the police for their "patience and service", adding that they "saved" his property. "For you with you always," the police said.

198.title: Bomb hurled at group celebrating b'day in Prayagraj, 3 injured
198.article_body: Three people in a group suffered minor injuries after another group hurled a bomb at them while celebrating a birthday party in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Police have arrested one person in connection with the case for questioning and suspected some past reason behind the matter. They said that minors are also involved in the case and will be arrested.

199.title: K'taka IT Minister lays foundation for anti-venom research centre in B'luru
199.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan laid the foundation for the Anti-Venom Research and Development Centre (AVRDC) in Bengaluru on Monday. The centre, which will begin operations at the Institute of Bioinformatics and Applied Biotechnology (IBAB) in Electronic City, will be built at a cost of â‚¹7 crore. It would help in lowering snakebite-related fatalities in the nation, the minister said.

200.title: Woman, partner kill her husband in staged road accident in Ahmedabad, arrested
200.article_body: A woman, along with her partner, was arrested for allegedly killing her 43-year-old husband by staging a road accident through contract killing in June in Ahmedabad. The man was hit by a speeding pick-up truck from behind. According to police, the accused paid â‚¹10 lakh to kill him. Investigation revealed the accused persons were in a relationship, an official said.

201.title: Italian man arrested for trying to enter India without visa
201.article_body: An Italian national was arrested for allegedly trying to enter India without a valid visa through the India-Nepal border in Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh. The accused, identified as Federico Negri (39), was stopped by the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) team for routine checking on Monday but he could not produce a valid visa, an official said.

202.title: Pune police to launch programme to stop youths from engaging in crime
202.article_body: Pune Rural Police will soon launch a programme in a bid to prevent youths from engaging in crime or illegal activities. It's "easy" to file cases and put youths behind bars, "but considering their age and career, we have decided to launch this programme", Additional SP Mitesh Ghatte said. The programme focuses on counselling for school and college students.

203.title: Tiger released in UP's reserve after experts say it poses no threat
203.article_body: A tiger was released in UP's Dudhwa Tiger Reserve on Tuesday after experts found that it posed no threat to humans. The tiger was captured along with a tigress following a series of human-animal conflict cases in the region. On observation, the forest officials found that the tigress was behind the attacks on humans and the tiger displayed no aggression.

204.title: Imran's party apologised to US over foreign conspiracy charge: Pak minister
204.article_body: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has claimed that former PM Imran Khan's party PTI apologised to US diplomat Donald Lu for levelling allegations of foreign conspiracy to topple the previous government. Asif claimed that Khan sent a message to Washington DC that he wanted to "fix things and relationship with the superpower".

205.title: India were very poor with the bat, ball, tactically: Vaughan on Day 4
205.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India were "very poor" with the bat, ball and tactically on day four of the fifth Test against England. "They did not realise that...England...have got a different mindset," added Vaughan. Discussing Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy on day four, Kevin Pietersen said, "For half an hour that was pure madness...Bumrah [didn't get his]...tactics right...at all."

206.title: TikTok sued over death of 2 girls who did 'blackout challenge': Report
206.article_body: TikTok has been sued over the death of two young girls in the US who died while trying the "blackout challenge" on the platform,  the Los Angeles Times reported. The lawsuits allege that Lalani Erika Walton, 8, and Arriani Jaileen Arroyo, 9, died after copying the trend. The app's algorithm allegedly recommended videos of the strangulation challenge to the girls.

207.title: 7-year-old girl sexually assaulted in Delhi's Laxmi Nagar
207.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by a stranger in Delhi's Laxmi Nagar area. The victim was playing outside her residence when the accused came and took her to an abandoned place before allegedly assaulting her, police said. Notably, the accused has been zeroed in and efforts are on to arrest him, police added.

208.title: SpiceJet flight from Delhi makes emergency landing in Pakistan
208.article_body: A SpiceJet flight from Delhi to Dubai made an emergency landing in Karachi, Pakistan after developing a technical fault. All passengers on board are safe, news agency ANI reported. Earlier this month, a Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight returned to the Delhi airport after the crew noticed smoke inside the plane.

209.title: Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' crosses â‚¹300-crore mark in India
209.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the â‚¹300-crore mark in India. The film, which was released in theatres on June 3, has earned more than â‚¹400 crore globally. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the action thriller also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya. 'Vikram' was released in multiple languages, including Hindi, Kannada, Telugu, Malayalam and Tamil.

210.title: Punjab govt appoints Delhi CM Kejriwal's batchmate as officiating DGP
210.article_body: The Bhagwant Mann-led government in Punjab appointed Gaurav Yadav, a 1992-batch IPS officer, as the state's officiating Director General of Police (DGP). Yadav, who is a civil services batchmate of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, is given this role in addition to his duty as Principal Secretary to Punjab CM's office after DGP VK Bhawra went on two months leave.

211.title: Get me home from Russia: Jailed US basketball player to Biden
211.article_body: American basketball player Brittney Griner, in a handwritten letter, appealed to  US President Joe Biden to get her home from jail in Russia, saying, "I'm terrified I might be here forever."  Griner was detained at a Moscow airport in mid-February for allegedly carrying cannabis vape cartridges. Griner went on trial on Friday. She faces up to 10 years in prison.

212.title: HC stays demolition drive in Patna's Nepali Nagar; DM says already complete
212.article_body: Patna High Court on Monday stayed the demolition drive in the city's Nepali Nagar area. However, the district magistrate said that before the order was received, the drive was already complete and 40-acre government land was cleared of encroachment. "By the time the order came...land was handed over to the housing board. It belongs to the housing board," DM added.

213.title: India's services sector growth hits 11-year high in June
213.article_body: India's services sector grew at the fastest pace in over 11 years in June amid strong demand. The S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 59.2 in June from 58.9 in May, its highest since April 2011. As per companies, the growth stemmed from ongoing improvements in demand following the retreat of COVID-19 restrictions and capacity expansion.

214.title: Student shares 'horrible experience' with IndiGo, Scindia says 'Luggage sent to hostel'
214.article_body: A student shared her "horrible experience" with IndiGo, saying she had to travel to four airports in 24 hours and when she finally reached destination, her luggage wasn't delivered. She tweeted, "How much more mental & physical exhaustion am I supposed to suffer?" Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia helped her, saying, "Your luggage has been delivered at hostel gate. Take care."

215.title: Aaditya Thackeray confronts rebel MLA, says 'didn't expect this', video surfaces
215.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray confronted rebel party MLA Prakash Surve for joining Eknath Shinde camp. In a video shared by Times Now, Thackeray can be seen talking to Surve. "I thought you were coming back to us...You were with us...This was not expected of you...There was so much love for you from all of us...I personally...felt bad," Thackeray said.

216.title: Superintendent of police arrested for raping pregnant woman in Punjab
216.article_body: A special investigation team (SIT) of Punjab Police on Monday arrested a superintendent of police for allegedly raping a pregnant woman at his official residence in Gurdaspur. The woman was having a dispute with her husband and in-laws. According to the FIR, the SP named Gurmeet Singh used to send vulgar messages to the victim and had threatened her.

217.title: Neha celebrates 20 yrs of Miss India win, jokes she's 'a few dress sizes bigger'
217.article_body: Neha Dhupia, taking to Instagram, shared a note as she completed 20 years of winning Miss India crown. The actress, who was felicitated by her parents at grand finale of Femina Miss India 2022, wrote, "I didn't think...it'd be possible to wear this crown on stage...again." "20 years later...I stood...stronger, more experienced and a few dress sizes bigger," Neha added.

218.title: No matter which format Shreyas plays, he's going to get bounced: Vaughan
218.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said India's Shreyas Iyer has got a "real issue" with short deliveries and he'll have to "iron it out" to continue playing international cricket. "No matter what he plays, T20, ODI or Tests...Shreyas is going to get bounced," stated Vaughan. Shreyas was dismissed off short balls in both innings in the ongoing Test against England.

219.title: Minecraft pays tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer
219.article_body: Minecraft has been updated with a tribute to the popular streamer Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer, aged 23. The game's tribute to the creator adds a new crowned pig to its splash screen, which was also the creator's YouTube channel icon. Minecraft said it was "heartbroken over the loss of Technoblade".

220.title: Confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls held in Maha: Raut
220.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that his party is confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls are conducted in Maharashtra. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's. You cannot hijack it through money," Raut added. Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the rebel MLAs were not only given money but also "something else", Raut said.

221.title: Karnataka Cong MLA's offices, houses raided by ACB in Bengaluru
221.article_body: Multiple Bengaluru-based properties linked to Karnataka Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan are being raided by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Tuesday. Khan was also booked by the ACB in the disproportionate assets case. Raids are being conducted at Khan's two offices and three residences which are located in areas including Sadashiva Nagar, Banashankari, Kalasipalya and Bengaluru Cantonment.

222.title: Pet dog stops robbery bid on ATM containing â‚¹27 lakh in J'khand
222.article_body: A robbery bid on an ATM on the ground floor of a house in Jharkhand's Hazaribag failed after the house's pet dog began barking and alerted its owner and neighbours, police said on Tuesday. The ATM contained â‚¹27 lakh, police added. The robbers, who'd arrived with gas cutters, LPG cylinders and hammers, escaped as people woke up, police further said.

223.title: ED raids over 40 locations of Vivo, related firms in money laundering probe
223.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday conducted raids at Chinese smartphone manufacturing company Vivo and related firms, officials said. The raids were carried out at 44 locations across the country under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Earlier in May, local units of ZTE Corporation and Vivo were investigated for alleged financial irregularities.

224.title: HC grants bail to Shiv Sena MP's associate in money laundering case
224.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to Shiv Sena MP Bhavana Gawali's associate, Saeed Khan, in connection with a money laundering case. Khan was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the case in September 2021. Khan was accused of converting a trust, associated with Gawali, into a company and becoming its director for wrongful gains.

225.title: Christian Eriksen likely to join Manchester United
225.article_body: Denmark's Christian Eriksen has reportedly agreed to join Manchester United on a three-year deal after his contract at Brentford ended last month. Eriksen had joined Brentford after Inter Milan terminated his contract due to his cardiac device implant. Eriksen suffered a cardiac arrest during Denmark's game against Finland at the European Championship in June last year.

226.title: Centre should release white paper on employment: T'gana minister
226.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday asked Centre to release a white paper on filling two crore jobs every year. "BJP...promised to offer two crore jobs every year and in eight years, 16 crore jobs had to be offered but...central government failed," Rao said. On the other hand, Telangana government has filled about 1.35 lakh posts, he added.

227.title: 70-year-old woman beaten to death by villagers in J'khand over 'witchcraft'
227.article_body: A 70-year-old woman was beaten to death by villagers in Jharkhandâ€™s Garhwa district, as they claimed that the woman practised "witchcraft", police said on Tuesday. In a complaint, the deceased womanâ€™s family alleged that five persons dragged her at least 200 metres from her house on Sunday at around 8:30 pm and beat her to death with sticks.

228.title: Delhi reports 32 dengue cases in June, 143 cases so far in 2022
228.article_body: According to a civic report, Delhi reported 32 dengue cases in June, taking this year's tally to 143. No related deaths have been reported in the national capital until now this year. Moreover, no new cases were reported this month until July 2. Also, Delhi has recorded 27 cases of malaria and eight cases of chikungunya so far in 2022.

229.title: My son Stefan likes to intimidate me on the court: Novak Djokovic
229.article_body: Talking about his son Stefan, Novak Djokovic said, "He likes to intimidate me on the court with finishing the swing here. He knows I don't like that particularly." "Whenever he does that, he always laughs because he knows," added Djokovic. "I try to use every available opportunity...to play with him because Stefan's...fully immersed into tennis," he stated.

230.title: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra claims receiving death threat via email
230.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday claimed that he received a death threat through email. In a tweet, Mishra shared a screenshot of the email that read, "Terrorist Kapil Mishra you will not be allowed to live long." Mishra further wrote that he isn't scared of such threats, adding, "Our campaign to help...families of victims of Jihadist violence...will continue...aggressively."

231.title: Razorpay blocks Alt News donation link, restores after 'clarity'
231.article_body: Days after fact-checker Mohammed Zubair's arrest, online payment gateway Razorpay deactivated the donation link for Alt News. However, the company restored it "following clarity on the issue". The company said it had temporarily disabled the account during the preliminary investigation by law enforcement authorities. This comes after Alt News refuted allegations of receiving funds from overseas.

232.title: If I play murderer, does it make me one: Kiara on criticism for 'Kabir..' role
232.article_body: While talking about being criticised for her role in the movie 'Kabir Singh', actress Kiara Advani asked, "If I play a murderer in my next film, does it make me one?" "It's hypocritical to praise actors who otherwise play a grey shade and then criticise them when they play a grey shade of a regular character," she added.

233.title: Ukraine is in talks with Turkey, UN on grain exports: Zelenskyy
233.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine is holding talks with Turkey and the UN on securing guarantees for grain exports. "This is a very important thing that someone guarantees...security of ships for this or that country, apart from Russia, which we don't trust. We, therefore, need security for those ships which will come here to load foodstuffs," he added.

234.title: We are optimistic about winning Edgbaston Test: Eng's Alex Lees
234.article_body: English opener Alex Lees has said that the England team is "optimistic" about winning the Edgbaston Test and levelling the series against India at 2-2. "If we bat well for the first 30-40 minutes tomorrow (Tuesday) morning, we should be in a pretty strong position...There is an ultimate belief from one to 11 [that] we can do it," Lees said.

235.title: Singapore Prez, Parliament Speaker, Culture Min test +ve for COVID
235.article_body: Singapore President Halimah Yacob, Speaker of Parliament Tan Chuan-Jin, and Culture Minister Edwin Tong have tested for COVID-19. The 67-year-old President, who is vaccinated and boosted, said that she is experiencing mild symptoms of COVID-19. Over the last 28 days, Singapore has reported 1,40,965 coronavirus infections. The country has recorded more than 14 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

236.title: Microsoft delegation gets 'Peace Prize' from Ukrainian President
236.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to announce that a Microsoft delegation has been awarded 'Peace Prize' from the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "We are grateful to have you on the light side of digital. Microsoft stands for truth and for peace," Fedorov said. Earlier, Microsoft took several actions in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

237.title: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino, wife Daniella blessed with a baby girl
237.article_body: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and his wife, model Daniella, have been blessed with their second child, a baby girl. The 59-year-old director and his 38-year-old wife had announced in February that they are expecting their second child. Their first child, son Leo, was born in February 2020. Tarantino and Daniella got married in November 2018.

238.title: NFT sales hit 12-month low in June after cryptocurrency crash
238.article_body: Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) reached a 12-month low in June following a downturn in the cryptocurrency market. The average number of daily sales of NFTs fell to around 19,000 in June in comparison to its peak between August and November last year when NFT sales were frequently topping more than 2,00,000 per day.

239.title: Haryana agrees to provide ACs in district attorneys offices after HC's order
239.article_body: The Haryana government has decided to provide facility of air conditioners (ACs) in offices of district attorneys (DAs) in the state. The decision comes after Haryana Attorney's Welfare Association filed a petition in the HC. Hearing the matter, the Punjab and Haryana High Court said that the request of the district attorneys "appears to be genuine", given their working conditions.

240.title: I merely quoted to my friend, no stooping factor: Resul on calling RRR 'gay love story'
240.article_body: 'Baahubali' producer Shobu Yarlagadda criticised Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty for calling 'RRR' a 'gay love story', saying, "Extremely disappointed that someone of your accomplishments can stoop so low!" Pookutty replied, "I merely quoted to my friend, the banter that already exists in public domain." He added, "There's no stooping factor...You don't have to take it seriously."

241.title: French actress Judith shares pics of her domestic abuse injuries; says 'I'm exhausted'
241.article_body: French actress Judith Chemla took to Instagram to post pictures of her domestic abuse injuries. "A year ago my face was injured, blue, purple under my eye. I have so much evidence that he continues to try and harm me," she wrote. "I am exhausted. What does it take to make him leave me alone?" she added.

242.title: Top Congress leaders discuss strategy for upcoming Gujarat polls
242.article_body: Congress leaders met on Monday to discuss the party's strategy for this year's Gujarat Assembly elections. According to PTI, the party finalised a strategy during the four-hour-long meet and decided to raise the issues of Dalits, tribals and farmers during their poll campaign. The meet was attended by several leaders including Priyanka Gandhi, Ajay Maken, P Chidambaram and Randeep Surjewala.

243.title: 'Pushpa' makers approach Sethupathi for a crucial role in sequel: Reports
243.article_body: The makers of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa' have reportedly approached Vijay Sethupathi to play an important role in the film's sequel titled 'Pushpa: The Rule'. According to reports, Sethupathi was initially a part of the first part too but he opted out due to date issues. In addition to Arjun, the second part will also feature Fahadh Faasil and Rashmika Mandanna.

244.title: France's Schneider Electric to sell Russia unit to local team
244.article_body: France's Schneider Electric has agreed to sell its Russian unit to the local leadership team. The firm is expected to write-off up to $313 million in net book value as a result of the divestment. "Schneider Electric is planning an orderly transfer and is allocating resources to support the employees in Russia and Belarus through the process," it said.

245.title: Amarnath Yatra temporarily suspended due to bad weather
245.article_body: The Amarnath Yatra has been temporarily suspended owing to bad weather. A batch of around 3,000 pilgrims was reportedly stopped at the Nunwan base camp on the Pahalgam route, while 4,000 more people were stopped in Chanderkote in the Ramban district. About 72,000 people have visited the shrine since the yatra started on June 30.

246.title: Impossible for Federer to win 21st singles Major: Ex-women's world no. 1
246.article_body: Ex-world number one in women's doubles Pam Shriver said, "Regardless of Roger Federer's comeback pathway, winning a 21st singles Major seems impossible given his knees, age and the effort it takes." "A big question will be: Can Federer play the best-of-five format the Majors demand in 2023, when he will be 41 years old," added Shriver.

247.title: Organisers respond after Djokovic says 'Wimbledon turning into indoor event'
247.article_body: After Novak Djokovic questioned the scheduling of the evening matches at Wimbledon, the All England Club CEO Sally Bolton said, "Once you start the day, you have no idea when the day is going to finish." Djokovic had said, "If you're scheduled last on the Centre, you're going to end up a match under the roof, which changes the conditions."

248.title: Stolen majority: Shiv Sena after Maharashtra CM Shinde wins trust vote
248.article_body: A day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in the Assembly by surpassing the majority mark of 144, Shiv Sena termed it a "stolen majority". "BJP and Shinde faction got vote of confidence...This is a stolen majority. This is not the belief of 11 crore people of Maharashtra," Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

249.title: NC, PDP to jointly fight J&K elections
249.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference (NC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) on Monday announced that they will jointly contest the Assembly elections. PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said, "We intend to contest the elections together as it is the will of the people that we should strive together for the restoration of our lost dignity."

250.title: Sinha vows he won't be 'rubber stamp' Prez, urges Murmu to do same
250.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday tweeted that he pledges to be an "impartial custodian" of the Constitution and not a "silent or rubber stamp" President. He also urged BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu to make the same pledge. "To ensure a better future for all Indians, the Rashtrapati (President) must work conscientiously," he said.

251.title: Trell Co-founder served legal notice over unpaid dues of â‚¹47 lakh
251.article_body: Trell Co-founder Bimal Kartheek Rebba has been served a legal notice by Creatify Web Services, which runs influencer management agency Idiotic Media, for unpaid dues amounting to â‚¹47 lakh. It has also demanded â‚¹5 lakh from Trell over mental agony and harassment. Earlier, it was reported that Trell hasn't paid some influencers for the last six to seven months.

252.title: 5 held in separate cases for sharing Udaipur murder video, photos with arms
252.article_body: Police arrested five people in separate cases in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh for allegedly circulating the video of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder and posting photos and videos with arms online. A 36-year-old was arrested for sharing the video and four others were arrested for posting photos and videos. Lal was beheaded by two men for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

253.title: 68,000 encroachments removed, â‚¹844-cr property seized in 100 days: UP CM
253.article_body: On completion of the first 100 days of CM Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government's second term, he said that over 68,000 illegal encroachments were removed. Properties worth â‚¹844 crore, belonging to criminals and the mafia, were seized in the last 100 days, he added. Over 1.20 lakh loudspeakers were either removed or their decibel levels were reduced, Adityanath further said.

254.title: Battled horrible pain due to rib injury: Nadal on Indian Wells final loss
254.article_body: Recalling his defeat against American player Taylor Fritz in the final of the 2022 edition of Indian Wells, which ended his 20-match winning streak, Rafael Nadal said he was in "horrible pain" due to a rib injury. "I knew something was...very wrong during the match," added Nadal. "I'm tired of talking about my body...and...the problems I have," he stated.

255.title: PMC to give NOC only after poll aspirant pays illegal hoardings' fine
255.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that it will only give a No Objection Certificate (NOC) to people who want to contest the civic body's elections after they pay the fine for putting up illegal hoardings. As per the rules, candidates must get NOCs from the civic body before contesting the elections, reported Hindustan Times.

256.title: Accused got bike, â‚¹10,000 to kill Amravati chemist who supported Nupur Sharma: Police
256.article_body: Amravati Police Commissioner Arti Singh has said that the mastermind Irfan paid â‚¹10,000 and a motorcycle to the accused to kill chemist Umesh Kolhe over a social media post supporting Nupur Sharma. The accused are Muddasar Ahmad (22), Shahrukh Pathan (25), Abdul Taufiq (24), Shoaib Khan (22), Atib Rashid (22), Yusuf Khan (32), and alleged mastermind Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim.

257.title: Not here to protect anyone: Karnataka CM Bommai to Congress
257.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress alleging that the party used to protect criminals when it was in power in the state. Speaking about the arrests of ADGP Amrit Paul and IAS officer J Manjunath, Bommai said that the accused would have been covered up if the Congress was in power. "We're not here to protect anyone," Bommai further said.

258.title: UP woman accuses husband of giving triple talaq over dowry
258.article_body: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur has accused her husband of giving her divorce through the outlawed practice of triple talaq. He had been allegedly harassing her for dowry. The woman claimed that the accused and his family members beat her up on July 3, demanding dowry. When she refused, her husband divorced her by pronouncing 'talaq' thrice, she added.

259.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan arrested over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
259.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan was arrested by Noida Police in Ghaziabad on Tuesday after misleading clips about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi were aired on his show. Gandhi called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused. Cases were registered against Rohit Ranjan in several states.

260.title: K'taka records 749 COVID-19 cases, 696 reported in Bengaluru alone
260.article_body: Karnataka on Monday recorded 749 new cases of COVID-19, out of which 696 were reported in Bengaluru alone. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the city reported zero deaths and 869 recoveries on Monday. With 6,075 active COVID-19 cases, the test positivity rate for the past seven days in Bengaluru stands at 5.22%, data showed.

261.title: U'khand villagers kill crocodile suspecting it killed boy; case filed
261.article_body: Villagers in Uttarakhand's Kumaon killed a crocodile by battering it with sticks on suspicion that it had killed a boy who was grazing cattle near a river. An x-ray was conducted, however, medical staff found no human body parts or bones in crocodile's stomach. A case will be filed under Wild Life (Protection) Act 1972, Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) said.

262.title: Tata Power signs MoU with Tamil Nadu for â‚¹3,000 cr solar plant
262.article_body: Tata Power has signed an MoU with the Tamil Nadu government to invest â‚¹3,000 crore for setting up a greenfield 4GW Cell and 4GW module solar manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu. The facility will create over 2,000 employment opportunities with the majority being women employees. The investment will be made over a period of 16 months.

263.title: Hyd man sets himself ablaze during marriage of woman he loved, dies
263.article_body: A 20-year-old man died after setting himself on fire at a marriage hall in Hyderabad where the woman he loved was being married to someone else. The incident took place on June 30 when the man barged into the hall, doused himself in fuel and lit himself with a matchstick, police said. He died during treatment on Sunday, police added.

264.title: I'm very happy making films: Akshay on if he's planning to join politics
264.article_body: Akshay Kumar, when asked if he's planning to join politics, said, "I am very happy making films." "As an actor, I do whatever possible to take up social issues," he added. "I have produced 150 films, the one nearest to my heart is 'Raksha Bandhan'. I produce commercial films, sometimes with social issues," Akshay further said.

265.title: South Korea's inflation touches 24-year high in June
265.article_body: South Korea's inflation rate reached a nearly 24-year high in June amid soaring energy and food prices. The Consumer Price Index rose 6% in June over a year earlier, the highest level since November 1998 during the Asian financial crisis. The CPI rose in almost every sector, with petrochemicals jumping 39.6% and the restaurants sector surging 8%.

266.title: Very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
266.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. Very heavy rainfall is very likely over Gujarat from July 7 to 9. It is very likely over Goa, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Odisha until July 9. Extremely heavy rainfall is likely over Gujarat, Maharashtra and Goa on July 7 and 8.

267.title: How have Indian cities ranked on the Global Liveability Index?
267.article_body: New Delhi received the top rank among Indian cities as it ranked 140 (score 56.5) on the Global Liveability Index 2022 released by the Economist Intelligence Unit. New Delhi was followed by Mumbai at 141 (score 56.2), Chennai at 142 (score 55.8), Ahmedabad at 143 (score 55.7) and Bengaluru at 146 (score 54.4). The ideal score is 100.

268.title: Undemocratic, unethical: Mamata on Eknath Shinde govt in Maharashtra
268.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government and called it "undemocratic" and "unethical". "His government will also not run for long. The BJP uses money power and muscle power along with agencies to go against electoral mandates," Mamata added. They might have formed government, but they have not won people's hearts, Mamata further said.

269.title: 18 killed during protests in Karakalpakstan: Uzbekistan govt
269.article_body: As many as 18 people were killed and 243 wounded during protests in Uzbekistan's autonomous Karakalpakstan province, said the authorities on Monday. The protests were triggered following reports saying the new constitutional amendments would curtail the province's autonomy by snatching its right to secede. The opposition leaders reportedly said that thousands of people had been hospitalised.

270.title: Won't stop fighting gun violence epidemic: Biden after July 4 shooting
270.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden expressed shock over the "senseless" shooting that killed at least six people during an Independence Day Parade. "I'm not going to give up fighting the epidemic of gun violence," Biden said, noting he'd recently signed the first significant gun control measures in decades into law but that "much more work" remains.

271.title: Man Utd can sign Neymar or Lewandowski if Ronaldo leaves: Reports
271.article_body: Manchester United can reportedly sign Paris Saint-Germain's Neymar or Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski if their forward Cristiano Ronaldo leaves the club. Notably, Bayern Munich and Italy's Napoli club are interested in signing Ronaldo, reports said. Manchester United is reportedly open to letting Ronaldo go to a non-English club if they are willing to take him on his Â£500,000-per-week contract.

272.title: Nadal defeats Botic to enter Wimbledon quarters for 8th time
272.article_body: Rafael Nadal reached his eighth Wimbledon quarter-finals after defeating Botic van de Zandschulp 6-4, 6-2, 7-6(8-6) in his fourth-round match. "Wimbledon is a tournament that I like so much. Have been three years without playing here...it means a lot for me," said Nadal. The 36-year-old had lost to Roger Federer in the 2019 semi-finals in his last appearance at Wimbledon.

273.title: When CM Yogi can establish peace in UP, why canâ€™t Gehlot?: Ex-Rajasthan CM
273.article_body: Following the Udaipur murder incident, former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje on Monday said a sense of fear and insecurity has arisen in the state which should be eliminated. "When Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath can establish peace in Uttar Pradesh by eliminating any atmosphere of terror, why can Ashok Gehlot not do it here?" Raje asked.

274.title: Govt lists Bihar, Andhra as states with emerging startup ecosystem
274.article_body: The third edition of the States' Startup Ranking of 2021 clubbed Andhra Pradesh and Bihar from the States category and Mizoram and Ladakh from the UTs/NE States under the 'Emerging Startup Ecosystem' category. Chhattisgarh, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan were declared 'Aspiring Leaders' among the states. Gujarat and Karnataka emerged as the best performers.

275.title: Avatar 4 is a corker, a mother****er, hope I can make it: Cameron
275.article_body: Director James Cameron said the fourth part of the 'Avatar' film franchise is a "corker" and a "mother****er", adding he hopes he gets to make it. "The 'Avatar' films...are...all-consuming," stated Cameron. Cameron has directed 'Avatar: The Way of Water', which will release on December 16, 2022, having directed the original film 'Avatar' which is one of the highest-grossing movies ever.

276.title: Man held for writing pro-Khalistan slogans on H'yana school, college walls
276.article_body: The police said on Monday that they arrested a man who allegedly wrote pro-Khalistan slogans on the walls of a college and a school in Haryana's Karnal last month. The accused and another person were promised $1,000 (nearly â‚¹79,000) to do so by a US-based man who contacted them via WhatsApp, police added. The other suspect is still at large.

277.title: 50,000 asked to evacuate as flood situation worsens in Australia
277.article_body: Around 50,000 residents were asked to evacuate in Australia's New South Wales on Tuesday as the flood situation in the region worsened. Several flood rescue operations, supported by the army, were carried out in Sydney. Around 19,000 homes were left without power. The administration has asked people to not leave their houses unless really needed.

278.title: Former B'luru DC arrested on bribery charges in land dispute case
278.article_body: Former Deputy Commissioner of Bengaluru city, J Manjunath, was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Monday on bribery charges in connection with a land dispute case. He is accused of accepting bribe for passing an order in favour of a complainant over ownership of 38 acres of land in Kudlu village. Two officials were earlier arrested in the case.

279.title: CM Shivraj Chouhan shares video playing badminton after election campaign
279.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan shared a video on Twitter in which he is seen playing badminton in Bhopal's Bhojpur Club. "When I got some time off from the election campaign, I enjoyed badminton...It felt like childhood had returned," he tweeted. The video came as Chouhan took a break after conducting roadshows and several public meetings on Monday.

280.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde holds meeting with officials amid Mumbai rains
280.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Mumbai and parts of Maharashtra, CM Eknath Shinde held a meeting and directed officials to keep a vigil and ensure that National Disaster Response Force squads are ready. CM is reviewing the situation, considering the warning of torrential rains in the next few days, Maharashtra CMO said. Mumbai recorded 95.81 mm of rainfall in 12 hours.

281.title: Chinese real estate firms take watermelons as down payment amid market slump
281.article_body: Amid a property market slump, Chinese real estate companies have started accepting down payments for houses in watermelon, garlic and other agricultural produce. A developer was reportedly allowing buyers to buy homes using watermelon at a rate of 20 yuan per kilogram. As per analysts, property sales in China dropped by 25% from January to June due to COVID-19 restrictions.

282.title: Suspect who shot & killed 3 in Danish mall remanded in psychiatric ward
282.article_body: A 22-year-old Danish man accused of killing three people and injuring several others during a shooting at a shopping mall in Copenhagen has been remanded into a closed psychiatric care facility for 24 days. The suspect has been charged with manslaughter and intent to kill. Two Danish teens, aged 17, and a 47-year-old Russian were killed in the attack.

283.title: India reports 13,086 new COVID-19 cases, 19 deaths in 24 hours
283.article_body: India has reported 13,086 COVID-19 cases, 12,456 recoveries and 19 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,135 cases and 24 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,14,475, while the death toll reached 5,25,242.

284.title: NZ male and female cricketers to receive equal pay in historic 5-year deal, list released
284.article_body: New Zealand Cricket and the players' association have signed a historic five-year deal that will see male and female cricketers receive equal pay. The match fees for a Test will be NZ$10,250, while it'll be NZ$2,500 for a T20I and NZ$4,000 for an ODI. The new agreement also increases the number of contracts offered to women cricketers in New Zealand.

285.title: Remove criminals from politics: Allahabad HC to Parliament, ECI
285.article_body: The Lucknow bench of Allahabad High Court has asked the Parliament and the Election Commission of India (ECI) to take steps to "remove criminals from politics" and break "unholy alliance" between organised crime, politicians and bureaucrats. "No one can dispute that the present-day politics is caught in crime, identity, patronage, muscle and money network," the bench said.

286.title: Video shows the moment police arrested US Independence Day parade shooting suspect
286.article_body: A video showing the moment police arrested the US Independence Day parade shooting suspect has surfaced on social media. Police arrested 22-year-old Robert Crimo after six people were killed in the shooting in Chicago's Highland Park. "Do me a favour, get on your knees...lay down flat on your stomach," an officer can be heard saying in the video.

287.title: Mumbai faces waterlogging as heavy rains lash city, Maha deploys NDRF teams
287.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai witnessed waterlogging as heavy rains lashed the city on Monday. News agency ANI said that areas including Sion in Mumbai and Khandeshwar Railway Station in Navi Mumbai witnessed waterlogging after rains. Reports also said that NDRF teams have been deployed in Maharashtra as a precautionary measure.

288.title: Wanted to hit Jadeja for 6 from 1st ball: Alex Lees on his 56(46) vs India
288.article_body: England opener Alex Lees has said he wanted to attack India's Ravindra Jadeja in his second innings on Day 4 in the ongoing Test. "If I am honest, I wanted to hit Jadeja for six first ball but yorked myself...I tried to hit the ball where the fielders weren't," he stated. Lees got run-out after scoring a 46-ball 56.

289.title: 12,000 workers fired in Indian startup ecosystem in 2022: Report
289.article_body: More than 12,000 employees in the Indian startup ecosystem and over 22,000 employees in the sector have lost their jobs in 2022, Crunchbase reported. Several major startups, including BYJU'S and Unacademy, have fired employees amid a funding winter. India is expected to see over 60,000 job losses in 2022 alone, led by edtech and e-commerce platforms.

290.title: MSEDCL flying squad uncovers power theft worth â‚¹98 lakh in Pune
290.article_body: A case has been filed after the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) flying squad uncovered power theft worth â‚¹98 lakh in Pune's Ravet. The matter came to light during surprise inspections carried out by an MSEDCL team. A builder allegedly used 2,04,292 units of electricity over 18 months by illegally manipulating the electricity meter using a remote control.

291.title: IMD issues orange alert for next 5 days in Mumbai
291.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange weather alert for the next five days in Mumbai. "An orange alert has been declared as a monsoon trough is currently active in this area, resulting in strong winds," IMD official KS Hosalikar said. Everyone should refer to 'Nowcast warnings' section on the IMD website every three hours for updates, he added.

292.title: It's a lot easier to play a villain than it is to play a hero: Bale on Gorr
292.article_body: Actor Christian Bale has said it was a "pleasure" playing Gorr in the upcoming Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "It's a lot easier to play a villain than it is to play a hero," said Bale, who played the titular role in Christopher Nolan's 'Batman' franchise. "Everyone is fascinated with bad guys immediately," Bale further said.

293.title: Man arrested for killing fisherman at Mumbai's Girgaon Chowpatty
293.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a fisherman at Girgaon Chowpatty in Mumbai last month. The accused, Suraj Yadav, had allegedly smashed the victim's, Gajannan Pawar, head with a stone following an argument, police said. Notably, Yadav had escaped to Mumbai after committing the murder of another man in a similar manner in Goa in March, police added.

294.title: SUV hits 33-yr-old woman in Delhi's Connaught Place; critical
294.article_body: A 33-year-old woman was seriously injured after an SUV hit her while she was on her way to work in Delhi's Connaught Place on Sunday morning. She swung in the air and dropped on the road nearly six feet away after being hit by the vehicle, an eye-witness told police. The woman has been hospitalised and is severely critical.

295.title: 3 drug peddlers arrested in Hyderabad; 30 grams of MDMA seized
295.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) along with SR Nagar Police on Monday arrested three drug peddlers. Police also seized 30 grams of MDMA and two cell phones worth â‚¹3 lakh from their possession. The apprehended persons along with the seized material were handed over to the station house officer of SR Nagar police station for further investigation, police said.

296.title: Eiffel Tower is in a poor state, needs repair to fix rusting issues: Reports
296.article_body: The Eiffel Tower is riddled with rust and requires repair work, as per reports. Among the most visited tourist sites in the world, reports suggest that the monument is in a poor state. It is currently undergoing a repaint for the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, which costs â‚¬60 million. Notably, this is the 20th time it is being repainted.

297.title: We are not traitors, we revolted: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde
297.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Monday said, "We are not traitors, we revolted (against the leadership) because of what was happening." "The one who orchestrated everything is here," Shinde said, pointing to Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. "I didnâ€™t force anyone to come with me. Nobody put a gun to anyoneâ€™s head," Shinde stated.

298.title: Former ADGP Amrit Paul arrested in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam case
298.article_body: Criminal Investigation Department arrested former Additional Director General of Police (ADGP), Amrit Paul, in Bengaluru in connection with the 2021 Karnataka police sub-inspectors (PSI) recruitment scam. He has been sent to police custody for 10 days. Paul was the head of police recruitment cell when the scam broke out in which OMR sheets were allegedly tampered with in the office.

299.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde recalls losing 2 kids, breaks down in Assembly
299.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde broke down while speaking in the state assembly on Monday. He remembered his family and said, "While I was working as a Shiv Sena Corporator in Thane, I lost two of my children and thought everything is over...I was broken but Anand Dighe Sahab convinced me to continue in politics."

300.title: Ukraine needs $750 bn to rebuild country: PM Shmyhal
300.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal has said it will cost an estimated $750 billion to rebuild the war-shattered country. "We believe that the key source of recovery should be the confiscated assets of Russia and Russian oligarchs," Shmyhal added. "The reconstruction of Ukraine is not a local project...but a common task of the entire democratic world," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

301.title: We could've batted England out of the game, but we couldn't: Vikram Rathour
301.article_body: With England needing 119 runs on the final day to win the ongoing rescheduled fifth Test, India batting coach Vikram Rathour has said they could've done better in their second innings and put England out of the game. "We could've batted England out of the game, but we couldn't. We should've shown better strategy as a batting unit," he stated.

302.title: Samsung Electronics to invest $500 million in Mexico
302.article_body: Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard has said that Samsung Electronics will invest $500 million in Mexico to increase the production of home appliances in the country. He took to Twitter to announce that the firm will invest in the northern border city of Tijuana and Queretaro in central Mexico. He added that he had met with Samsung's CEO Han Jong-Hee.

303.title: Civic workers in Bengaluru end protest over permanent jobs
303.article_body: Civic workers (pourakarmikas) in Bengaluru, who were protesting for four days demanding their jobs be converted from contractual to permanent basis, called off the strike on Monday. The stir ended after the Karnataka government asked a newly-formed committee to look into their demands. A protester said they have been working for 20 years but still not made permanent.

304.title: Umpire heard angrily telling Stuart Broad to shut up on stump mic, video surfaces
304.article_body: Umpire Richard Kettleborough was heard angrily telling England's Stuart Broad to shut up on stump mic during the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Broad was seen remonstrating with the umpire after facing bouncers, following which Kettleborough said, "Let us do the umpiring...you do the batting...alright? Otherwise...you're going to get into trouble again...Get on with batting and shut up."

305.title: Indian fans allegedly suffer racist abuse during India-England Test, investigation on
305.article_body: Several Indian fans have alleged that they suffered racist abuse in the stands at Edgbaston during India's rescheduled fifth Test against England. "We reported it to the stewards and showed them the culprits at least 10 times, but no response," one of the fans tweeted. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) later said that they are investigating the matter.

306.title: Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after Lees' wicket goes viral, fans react
306.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after opener Alex Lees' wicket in England's second innings of the Edgbaston Test has gone viral. Kohli was seen making a celebratory run towards departing Lees, roaring and punching in the air. "He is the life of Test cricket," a fan commented. "This Kohli is much better than the quiet one," wrote another.

307.title: UP man sells chicken on paper with photo of Hindu god, goddess; arrested
307.article_body: A man named Talib Hussain was arrested in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by selling chicken on a piece of paper carrying a picture of a Hindu god and goddess and also attacking a police team. When a police team reached his shop, Hussain attacked them with a knife with an intention to kill, the FIR said.

308.title: Police arrest suspect after 6 killed in US Independence Day parade shooting
308.article_body: Police announced they have captured a suspect after six people were killed and more than 36 were wounded in a shooting during a US Independence Day parade in the Chicago suburb of Highland Park. Police said they captured 22-year-old Robert Crimo. The shooting took place from rooftop of a business that the gunman reached via an alley ladder, police said.

309.title: Nobody is kind when you aren't saleable: Actor Zayed Khan on B'wood
309.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan, who featured in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Main Hoon Na', said "nobody is kind" to you in Bollywood when you are not saleable. "Success is like an accident you have to survive...You have to grow thick skin," added Zayed. Talking about his ex-brother-in-law, actor Hrithik Roshan, Zayed stated, "I love him from the bottom of my heart."

310.title: Now ED's target won't be Maha but other states like Chhattisgarh: Baghel
310.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that now target of central agencies like ED and CBI won't be Maharashtra but they all will become active in Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Rajasthan or southern states. "In the last eight years of the Modi govt, there haven't been proceedings on a single BJP-ruled state. This is a misuse of government agencies," he added.

311.title: Boy kidnapped for â‚¹20 lakh ransom rescued within 6 hours: Pune Police
311.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police said that they rescued a 15-year-old boy six hours after he was allegedly kidnapped for a ransom of â‚¹20 lakh on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. Police arrested three men and detained two minors in connection with the case. "A probe revealed the accused had known that boy's family had three food stalls," police added.

312.title: 24-year-old man kills father using scissors after argument in Hyd
312.article_body: A 24-year-old man was taken into custody by the police after he allegedly killed his father using scissors following an argument over a minor issue in Hyderabad's Golconda. The accused, who is unemployed and a habitual alcoholic, used to get into altercations with his parents frequently, according to the police. The accused's mother filed a complaint in the matter.

313.title: Series of earthquakes hit Andaman and Nicobar Islands
313.article_body: A series of earthquakes hit the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on July 5, according to the National Center for Seismology. The strongest tremor, marked 5.0 on the Richter scale, was recorded at 5:57 am on Tuesday. An earthquake of 4.4-magnitude hit the islands at 2:54 am today, while a 4.5-magnitude tremor was recorded at 1:30 am.

314.title: Centre shuffling Delhi officers like deck of cards: Dy CM Manish Sisodia
314.article_body: The Centre is shuffling Delhi officers like a deck of cards, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "Centre is playing with future of Delhi's six lakh children...after unconstitutionally snatching away Arvind Kejriwal-led government's services department," he added. Since 2018, nine principal secretaries and seven directors of Delhi's Department of Training and Technical Education have been transferred.

315.title: Took us 1 yr 4 months to make Shamshera set, 2.5 yrs for VFX: Director Karan
315.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra said that film's set construction took one year and four months. "[It took] 500+ workers along with crew members of setting department, 140 days of shoot and it took 2.5 years for us to work on our VFX to bring 'Shamshera' in its finest glory to our audiences," he added.

316.title: Man says he works in PM's office, seeks tourist arrangements; booked in K'taka
316.article_body: The Karnataka police have booked an unidentified man who allegedly sought tourist arrangements in the state by claiming that he works in the Prime Minister's Office. A complaint filed in the case said that the person sought arrangements for staying at a resort, a jungle safari, arrangements to visit a temple and viewing of a rare-flowering tree in the region.

317.title: IAS officer shares pics of book he used for UPSC preparation, calls it his 'favourite'
317.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan on Monday shared pictures of a book he used for UPSC preparation and wrote, "My brother shared the pages of my favourite book during UPSC preparation." Pictures showed heavily marked pages of the book titled 'The Wonder That Was India' by AL Basham. "Hard work always pays off," a Twitter user reacted to his post.

318.title: Shireen Akleh likely killed by unintentional Israeli gunfire: US
318.article_body: After summarising investigations by the Israeli and Palestinian sides, the US Security Coordinator has concluded that Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was likely killed by unintentional gunfire from Israeli positions, the US State Department said Monday. However, the bullet was badly damaged which prevented ballistic experts from reaching a clear conclusion, the department added.

319.title: India need 7 wickets on last day to beat England in rescheduled 5th Test
319.article_body: India need seven wickets on the last day to defeat England in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. England ended the fourth day at 259/3 in the second innings, needing another 119 runs to win the match. Earlier in the day, India were dismissed for 245 in their second innings, with Cheteshwar Pujara and Rishabh Pant hitting fifties.

320.title: Chinese-Canadian billionaire due to go on trial in China: Canada
320.article_body: Chinese-Canadian billionaire Xiao Jianhua, who was allegedly detained by Chinese officials from a Hong Kong hotel in 2017, was expected to go on trial in China on Monday, Canada's embassy in Beijing informed. An embassy official read a statement saying, "Consular officials are monitoring this case closely, providing consular services to his family and continue to press for consular access."

321.title: What is happening: Urfi Javed on social media user claiming she is dead
321.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed reacted to a post claiming she has died in a now-deleted post on Instagram Stories. She wrote, "What is happening in this world? I have been receiving so many death threats and now this! The comment says they stand with my murderer!" The post read, "RIP Urfi Javed a big loss for [no one]."

322.title: PM Modi to visit Varanasi on July 7, inaugurate multiple projects
322.article_body: PM Modi will visit Varanasi on July 7 where he will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for multiple projects worth â‚¹1,800 crore at the Dr Sampurnanand Sports Stadium, as per the PMO. He will also inaugurate the Akshay Patra Mid-Day Meal Kitchen at LT College with a capacity of cooking mid-day meals for around one lakh students.

323.title: My abortion saved my life: Halsey pens open letter on US SC's abortion ruling
323.article_body: Singer Halsey has written an open letter in Vogue following the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn the landmark ruling which granted women abortion rights. Halsey wrote, "My abortion saved my life and gave way for my son to have his." She further wrote she had three miscarriages before turning 24, one of which required abortion to avoid risking sepsis.

324.title: Kyrgios reaches quarters at Wimbledon for the first time in 8 years
324.article_body: Unseeded Nick Kyrgios reached the quarter-final at Wimbledon for the first time in eight years following a 4-6, 6-4, 7-6(7-2), 3-6, 6-2 win against American Brandon Nakashima on Monday. "It wasn't near my best performance, level wise but I'm just super, super happy to get through," said Kyrgios. The 27-year-old won the fourth round match in three hours 11 minutes.

325.title: Anupam Kher gets injured on sets while shooting for Kaagaz 2: Reports
325.article_body: Anupam Kher, who's shooting for 'Kaagaz 2', reportedly got injured on the set of the film, but after taking a brief break, the actor resumed work the very same day. According to reports, it was an intense courtroom scene and Kher hit his head on table. Reports added it wasn't that serious. He was injured but there was no bleeding.

326.title: Tesla sued by Black employees over racial discrimination in US
326.article_body: Tesla is facing a mass action lawsuit from 15 current and former Black employees who have alleged that the company operates under a "pre-Civil Rights" atmosphere. The lawsuit, filed in a California court, claimed that employees faced racial harassment at Tesla factories which transformed into a hostile work environment. The complaint included allegations of derogatory language used by supervisors.

327.title: Kazakhstan's Rybakina beats Martic to enter maiden Wimbledon quarters
327.article_body: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina entered her first Wimbledon quarter-final after defeating unseeded Croatian Petra Martic 7-5, 6-3 in one hour 20 minutes on Monday. "It means a lot to me (to be in the quarter-final)," said Rybakina. The 17th seed hit 26 winners to Martic's 13 in fourth round. Notably,  Rybakina hasn't dropped a set during her run to the quarter-final.

328.title: Activist Sharjeel Imam claims he was assaulted in jail, called 'terrorist'
328.article_body: Activist Sharjeel Imam, who is in judicial custody in connection with the Northeast Delhi riots, on Monday moved a city court and claimed he was assaulted by convicts at Tihar Jail. He added that he was allegedly called a "terrorist" and "anti-national" during an "illegal search" inside his cell. Imam also claimed there was threat to his life in prison.

329.title: Several people shot during Independence Day parade in US
329.article_body: An active shooting situation has been reported from an Independence Day parade in Illinois in the US with reports saying that multiple people are believed to have been injured. At least one person was feared dead, Reuters reported, quoting local media. The incident was reported in the wealthy Highland Park suburb of Chicago.

330.title: Kangana appears before court, pleads not guilty in Javed's defamation case
330.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut appeared before the court of the metropolitan magistrate in Mumbai's Andheri and pleaded not guilty in the defamation case filed by lyricist Javed Akhtar. The actress also asked for the trial to proceed behind closed doors as she doesn't want a "media trial". This is Kangana's third appearance before court since the case was filed in 2020.

331.title: Israel & Poland to restore ties after Holocaust restitution row
331.article_body: Israel and Poland have agreed to restore ties that became strained after Warsaw introduced a law in 2021 limiting ability of Jews to recover World War Two properties. The countries have mutually decided to restore their respective ambassadors. "Both presidents expressed...hope that any future issues...will be solved through sincere and open dialogue," a statement issued by Israeli President read.

332.title: China urges Myanmar military junta to hold talks with opponents
332.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi during his Myanmar visit urged the country's military junta to hold talks with its opponents and "realise political reconciliation". A read-out of Wang's remarks released by his ministry read, "China expects all parties in Myanmar to prioritise the big picture and the interests of the people... and realise...lasting peace and stability at an early date."

333.title: Garin enters 1st Grand Slam quarters after 4-hour 34-minute win at Wimbledon
333.article_body: World number 43 Cristian Garin came back from two sets and 3-0 down to complete a 2-6, 5-7, 7-6(7-3), 6-4, 7-6(10-6) win against the 19th seed Alex De Minaur to reach his first Grand Slam quarter-final at Wimbledon on Monday. The Chilean saved two match points during his four-hour 34-minute win in the fourth round.

334.title: Disqualification notices sent to Uddhav camp's MLAs except Aaditya Thackeray
334.article_body: Shiv Sena chief whip Bharat Gogawale of Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's camp on Monday said they have sent disqualification notices to all the MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction for defying their whip during the floor test. However, Gogawale said they haven't sent notice to Aaditya Thackeray due to their respect for Balasaheb Thackeray.

335.title: Turkish court refuses to extradite suspect in Haiti Prez's killing
335.article_body: A Turkish court on Monday rejected request to extradite a man to Haiti over his alleged involvement in the assassination of President Jovenel Moise. The accused, Samir Handal, was detained in Turkey on an Interpol red notice while he was transiting the country to reach Jordan from US last year. Moise was shot dead at his residence in July 2021.

336.title: Man who entered CM Mamata's house says he thought it was Kolkata Police HQ
336.article_body: A man, who was arrested for allegedly entering the premises of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence after crossing over a wall late at night, told police he did so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters. "He couldn't give any proper reply when asked why he wanted to go to police headquarters at that hour," a police officer said.

337.title: Sana reaches Saudi Arabia with husband for her first Hajj, says 'I'm excited'
337.article_body: Former actress Sana Khan shared a video montage after she reached Saudi Arabia for her first Hajj with her husband Anas Saiyad. Taking to Instagram, Sana shared a video and said, "This is my first Hajj and you can see my eyes are swollen. I'm very...excited of course as this was my dream that God has fulfilled today...It's amazing."

338.title: Happy the way we batted: Harmanpreet on India's 10-wicket win vs SL
338.article_body: India Women skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said she was happy with her side's batting in the 10-wicket win against Sri Lanka Women in second ODI. Smriti Mandhana(94*) and Shafali Verma(71*) added a 174-run partnership for the opening wicket. "We've been talking about long partnerships and thankfully we got it today...it was outstanding to watch," she added. India lead three-match series 2-0.

339.title: Will visit Guj every week, address issues: Kejriwal ahead of polls
339.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections in Gujarat, AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he will visit the state every week and discuss various issues with residents. Kejriwal made these remarks at a meeting organised on the issue of electricity in Gujarat. He added that the state will get free electricity up to 200 units if AAP is elected.

340.title: Neha Dhupia felicitated at Miss India to mark 20 years of her win
340.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia was felicitated at the 2022 Femina Miss India finale by her parents to mark 20 years since she won the title in 2002. Neha was also joined on stage by her husband Angad Bedi and their two children. The Miss India Instagram page shared pictures, writing, "Thank you Neha Dhupia, for being...a mentor to our ladies."

341.title: I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage: Farah Khan
341.article_body: Choreographer-filmmaker Farah Khan made an appearance at 'Swayamvar-Mika Di Vohti'. Speaking about singer Mika, Farah said, "Mika is a very sensitive person, only a sorted girl can handle him. I feel...you should marry when you find the right person." Sharing her own experience, she said, "I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage."

342.title: Gauri Lankesh's murder trial begins in Bengaluru court
342.article_body: Almost five years after she was murdered, journalist and activist Gauri Lankesh's murder trial began at a Bengaluru sessions court. The 55-year-old editor of Lankesh Patrike was shot dead outside her home in September 2017. Of the 18 accused, 17 have been arrested, and the court will hear the matter for five days during the second week of every month.

343.title: Maha state power discom removes 5 meter-reading agencies
343.article_body: Maharashtra's state power distribution company MSEDCL has terminated the services of five private meter-reading agencies after finding negligence in taking the readings, the company said Monday. It added, "Three agencies are from Solapur district, while two are from Pune district." All electric meter-reading agencies are currently under scrutiny from MSEDCL following complaints of discrepancies.

344.title: Payments startup slice appoints Sudeep Behari as its Business Head
344.article_body: Payments startup slice has appointed Sudeep Behari as its new Business Head. With Behari having more than 16 years of experience in the credit finance industry, slice said that the decision was taken with the aim of expanding the company's services to a wider audience. Prior to joining slice, Behari was leading the ICICI-Amazon credit card partnership.

345.title: Crypto exchanges' trading volume falls by 70% in 3 days as TDS rule takes effect
345.article_body: Trading volumes on Indian cryptocurrency exchanges declined by at least 70% in three days after the new rule requiring 1% tax deduction at source on every transaction came into effect on July 1. Trading volumes on WazirX were down the most at 82%, as per data from Crebaco. Meanwhile, ZebPay and CoinDCX saw a decline of 76% and 70%, respectively.

346.title: Wore 8-9 pairs of black jeans for song Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela: Bobby
346.article_body: As Bobby Deol-starrer 'Gupt' completed 25 years, the actor recalled shooting for his song 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela'. He said, "I would rehearse so much that I was drenched in sweat by the end of it." "And then white patches would be visible because of it. I wore eight-nine pairs of black jeans for that one song," he added.

347.title: India Women record their highest stand vs SL Women in ODIs, win series
347.article_body: Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma's 174-run first wicket partnership helped India Women beat Sri Lanka Women by 10 wickets in second ODI in Pallekele to take a 2-0 lead and win the three-match series. Notably, it's India's highest partnership for any wicket against the hosts in ODIs. Smriti's 94* and Shafali's 71* helped the visitors chase 174 in 25.4 overs.

348.title: Dead man wins sarpanch polls in MP, authorities look for solution
348.article_body: A deceased man has won sarpanch elections in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district.
