The man, Ravindra Thakur, passed away due to cardiac arrest on June 22, but his name appeared on ballot papers for July 1 polls as authorities weren't informed, an official said. "We've sought the opinion of the state election commission," Sagar Collector Deepak Arya said.

349.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha to take oath as MLA on July 8
349.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha will take oath as MLA on July 8, Tripura Assembly speaker said on Monday. He added that Saha met Rajya Sabha chairman and Vice President, M Venkaiah Naidu, to tender his resignation as Rajya Sabha MP on Monday. Saha had won the by-election from Town Bardowali assembly seat, after assuming office as CM on May 14.

350.title: Media landscape has changed in past few years: Thakur
350.article_body: BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday said that the media landscape has changed in the past few years and the emergence of digital media has made information accessible. However, he cautioned against the challenges, including the spread of misinformation and competition for traditional mediums. COVID-19 pandemic became infodemic and this problem arose globally, Thakur added.

351.title: Video shows Sidhu Moosewala's shooters waving guns, celebrating in car
351.article_body: A video showing shooters accused of killing singer Sidhu Moosewala waving guns and celebrating in a car is being widely shared on social media. The video was reportedly found on a phone of one of the accused shooters. The shooters in the video are Ankit Sirsa, Priyavrat, Kapil, Sachin Bhivani and Deepak, according to ANI.

352.title: Was suppressed for long time; won't resort to vendetta politics: Shinde
352.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday said that the rebellion led by him was a fallout of the unfair treatment meted out to him, but added that he won't resort to vendetta politics. "I alone had closed down 16 ladies' bars in and around Thane. There are some 100 various criminal charges registered against me," he said.

353.title: India has eliminated all queues by going online: PM at Digital India Week
353.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at Digital India Week 2022 in Gujarat, on Monday said, "India has eliminated all queues by going online." "Eight to 10 years ago, we had to stand in queues...to pay bills, for ration, for admission, for exam results, in banks," he added. "Government's Digital India programme has given relief to poor from corruption," the PM said.

354.title: Don't make us seek an independent Tamil Nadu: DMK's A Raja
354.article_body: DMK MP A Raja on Monday demanded that Centre should grant 'state autonomy' to Tamil Nadu and not push party to seek an independent country. Raja, who made these remarks while addressing party's local body representatives in Namakkal, said that DMK won't rest until demand is fulfilled. Meanwhile, fellow party leader TKS Elangovan said that Raja made comments in "frustration".

355.title: Few focused on why there's Modi's pic on vaccination certificates: PM
355.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday criticised Opposition leaders who questioned his picture on COVID-19 vaccination certificates. "The world is discussing how we managed to give COVID-19 vaccination certificates to people just after they got jabbed, but few people were focused on why is there Modi's photo on these certificates," he said. PM Modi was speaking in Gujarat.

356.title: India issues statement, asks Canada to remove film poster showing goddess Kali smoking
356.article_body: Amid controversy over Leena Manimekalai's documentary film Kaali's poster, which shows the goddess smoking, the Indian High Commission has issued a statement saying they've urged the Canadian authorities to withdraw all provocative material. India said it received several complaints. Manimekalai had tweeted the poster while informing about the documentary's screening at Toronto's Aga Khan Museum.

357.title: Salman Khan to launch Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood: Reports
357.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will reportedly launch singer Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood. According to reports, the rapper will be seen in Salman's forthcoming film 'Bhaijaan'. As per reports, Salman has given the responsibility of songs for the film to Honey and Devi Sri Prasad. The project marks Honey Singhâ€™s first collaboration with Devi Sri Prasad, reports added.

358.title: BJP uses criminal elements for its own propaganda: Mehbooba Mufti
358.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti alleged that the BJP is using criminal elements to perpetuate its propaganda of "communal division and hatred." Referring to media reports claiming that the murderer of the Udaipur tailor, and an LeT terrorist arrested from Jammu had links to the BJP, she said that had these been associated with Opposition leaders, multiple FIRs would be filed.

359.title: Andhra minister requests PM Modi, CM for selfie at event; video surfaces
359.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi addressed a public meeting in Andhra Pradesh's Pedamiram on Monday, state Tourism and Culture Minister RK Roja requested him and Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy for a selfie. PM Modi and the CM obliged and posed for a picture. Earlier in the day, PM Modi said Andhra Pradesh is the land of heroes and patriots.

360.title: It was an opportunity to bat all-overs: Powell on his 61* vs Bangladesh
360.article_body: Contributing to his team's 35-run win against Bangladesh in second T20I, West Indies batter Rovman Powell said he took the opportunity to advance the score and bat all-overs. "Platform was already set by captain [Nicholas Pooran] and Brandon King...I think they played well before I got to the crease," he added. Batting at number five, Powell scored a 28-ball 61*.

361.title: Fourth crew member of ship that sank off Hong Kong coast rescued
361.article_body: A fourth crew member of the engineering ship that sank near the coast of Hong Kong on Saturday was rescued on Monday. According to Guangdong maritime authorities, the crew member was rescued by a navy ship and is in stable condition. The China-registered floating crane Fujing 001 sank in the South China Sea after being hit by Typhoon Chaba.

362.title: Ukrainian flag raised on Snake Island after Russian retreat, pic surfaces
362.article_body: The Ukrainian flag has been raised again on Snake Island, days after Ukraine claimed to have driven the Russian forces out of the area. A picture of the flag installed on the island located in the Black Sea has also been shared online by Ukrainian officials. Russia's Snake Island withdrawal could loosen its blockade on Ukrainian ports, experts have said.

363.title: Pant creates record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper
363.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant has set the record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper. The 24-year-old set the record by aggregating 203 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. The previous record was set by Vijay Manjrekar, who had scored 161 runs against West Indies in Kingston, Jamaica in 1953.

364.title: What can consumers do if any hotel or restaurant levies service charge?
364.article_body: Consumers can request hotels or restaurants levying service charge to remove it from the bill amount, the government has said. Consumers can also lodge a complaint on National Consumer Helpline by calling 1915 or through the mobile app. Further, they can file a complaint against unfair trade practice with the Consumer Commission or submit a complaint to the District Collector.

365.title: Amarnath pilgrim critically injured after falling off pony, airlifted by Army
365.article_body: The Indian Army on Monday airlifted a 50-year-old critically injured pilgrim undertaking the Amarnath Yatra from the Brarimarg helipad on Baltal track in Jammu and Kashmir to the nearest medical facility. The man sustained injuries after his pony lost balance and he fell down around 100 feet towards Sindh river, officials said. The pilgrim was returning to the base camp.

366.title: New Maha govt won't last long, many contradictions in it: Cong leader
366.article_body: Congress leader HK Patil on Monday said that the newly-formed Maharashtra government under CM Eknath Shinde "won't last long" as there are too many "contradictions" in it. "Shiv Sena MLAs are restless. The way they have travelled so much shows they are not united," he added. Patil stated that Congress will remain a part of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA).

367.title: Magnitude 4.4 earthquake hits Andaman & Nicobar Islands
367.article_body: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake had hit the Andaman & Nicobar Islands on Monday, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to data provided by the agency, the earthquake's epicentre was located 256 km South-East of Port Blair, at a depth of 10 km. Earlier in the day, a 3.2 magnitude earthquake hit J&K, as per the agency.

368.title: ED attaches 16 properties worth â‚¹137 crore of B'luru-based real estate firm
368.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday said it has provisionally attached 16 immovable properties worth â‚¹137.60 crore of Bengaluru-based real estate firm Dreamz Infra India Limited in connection with a scam. The scam was exposed in 2017 after police found that at least 5,000 people were cheated of â‚¹1,500 crore. Three prime accused in the case have already been arrested.

369.title: Video shows Rahul offering food to woman, later hugging her in Kerala
369.article_body: The Congress party has shared a video showing party leader Rahul Gandhi offering food to a woman at an eatery during his visit to Kerala's Wayanad. The video shows Rahul asking his colleague KC Venugopal, "Why can't she sit with us...Does she want tea?" The Congress leaders then offered her food, following which Rahul hugged her.

370.title: NIA chief meets Amit Shah over Udaipur, Amravati killings: Reports
370.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) chief Dinkar Gupta reportedly met Union Home Minister Amit Shah at his office over the two killings in Rajasthan's Udaipur and Maharashtra's Amravati. This comes after the Ministry of Home Affairs directed the NIA to take over the investigation of the two murders. The MHA said that the conspiracy behind the killings would be probed.

371.title: 10,000 female aspirants register for Navy's Agnipath scheme till Sunday
371.article_body: Around 10,000 female aspirants registered themselves for the recruitment of sailors in the Indian Navy under the newly introduced Agnipath scheme till Sunday, according to government officials. The registration process began on Friday. This is the first time that women will be inducted as sailors in the Indian Navy. Online application for recruitment is scheduled to open on July 15.

372.title: SC to hear plea on AIADMK leadership row on July 6
372.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear a plea by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on July 6. The plea challenges a Madras High Court order staying the passing of resolutions in AIADMK General Council Meeting. The plea will be heard subject to clearance from Chief Justice NV Ramana, vacation bench of Justices Indira Banerjee and JK Maheshwari said.

373.title: I was first choice for 'Ghajini', but didn't like the story: Madhavan
373.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has revealed that he was the first choice for 2005 Tamil film 'Ghajini' but rejected it because he did not like the story. The role was portrayed by Suriya. "'Ghajini' becoming a hit was a very big thing," the actor added. The film was remade in Hindi in 2008 starring Aamir Khan and Asin.

374.title: Large number of fish found dead in Delhi's Najafgarh drain, samples collected
374.article_body: A large number of fish were found dead in the upstream stretch of Najafgarh drain along Delhi-Haryana border in the last few days. "The number of dead fish could be in lakhs. It could be due to the release of an excessive amount of pollutants," a forest department official said. Water samples from the drain have been collected for testing.

375.title: Bodies of 5 Army personnel killed in Manipur landslide sent to home stations
375.article_body: The mortal remains of five Territorial Army personnel, who were killed in the landslide in Manipur's Noney district, were sent to their respective home stations by an IAF aircraft on Monday. The deceased personnel were accorded full military honours at the Imphal airport by senior Army and Assam Rifles officials. The death toll in the incident has risen to 42.

376.title: SriLankan Airlines' ops to be impacted due to fuel crisis: Report
376.article_body: Sri Lanka's national carrier SriLankan Airlines' flight operations will reportedly be impacted till July 18 due to a crunch in jet fuel supplies amid the country's economic crisis. The airline reportedly ran out of available jet fuel stocks on June 29. Notably, Sri Lanka has barred the sale of fuel, except supplies required for essential services, till July 10.

377.title: What are the highest successful run chases against India in Test cricket history?
377.article_body: India have set a target of 378 runs for England in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. The record for the highest successful run chase against India in Test cricket history is held by Australia, who chased down a 339-run target in Perth in 1977. It is followed by target of 276 runs (West Indies) and 240 runs (South Africa).

378.title: Laxman to coach Team India in first T20I against England: Report
378.article_body: Ex-India batter VVS Laxman will reportedly coach Team India in first T20I against England in Southampton. The National Cricket Academy (NCA) Director was appointed as India's head coach in the side's recently concluded two-match T20I series against Ireland. Laxman was given the responsibility because the regular head coach Rahul Dravid was with India in England for the rescheduled fifth Test.

379.title: Reminds me of SpiceJet jeans, kurti uniform: SpiceJet ex-COO on Akasa crew uniform
379.article_body: SpiceJet's former COO Sanjiv Kapoor reacted to the newly-released look of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform, saying, "Love the sneakers!" Kapoor said, "(It) reminds me of the casual jeans and kurtis weekend uniform we had introduced at SpiceJet in 2014." He added, "Casual and fun works well for low-cost carriers (LCC). Good an Indian LCC will have it now."

380.title: We have a great chemistry: Kriti on working with Kartik in Shehzada
380.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actress Kriti Sanon said it has always been fun to work with him. She added they've great chemistry and their give and take as actors have always been...good. "So it's nice to reunite after Luka Chuppi," she said. Meanwhile, on the work front, Kriti was last seen in 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

381.title: Villagers spot Pakistani drone in Jammu and Kashmir
381.article_body: Villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district claimed to have spotted a Pakistani drone, a police official said. The drone was spotted in Rajpura area along the Indo-Pakistan international border, and the SOG Samba launched a search operation. The search operation used drones to scan but found nothing. This is the second drone sighting in Samba in last one month.

382.title: Who are the 5 new ministers in CM Bhagwant Mann's expanded Cabinet?
382.article_body: Five MLAs were sworn in as ministers in Punjab on Monday as Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expanded his Cabinet for the first time after forming government in the state. The legislators who took oath are Aman Arora, Dr Inderbir Singh Nijjar, Fauja Singh Sarari, Chetan Singh Jouramajra and Anmol Gagan Mann. The Cabinet now has 15 ministers, including the CM.

383.title: US-headquartered unicorn startup Amagi aims to list in India: Co-founder
383.article_body: New York-headquartered Amagi, a media-tech software-as-a-service (SaaS) unicorn, is aiming to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in India, Co-founder Baskar Subramanian said in an episode of CNN-News18's Bits to Billions. With Amagi's profits growing more than two-fold in FY21, Subramanian said profitability is an addictive phenomenon. Further, he said that frugality helps with innovation.

384.title: Delhi govt installs CCTV cameras at critical water logging points
384.article_body: The Delhi government has installed CCTV cameras at critical water logging points in the city, with an aim of ensuring that they're monitored. According to PWD officials, there will be round-the-clock monitoring of the critical water logging points as the CCTV feed will be sent to the PWD control room from where instructions will be sent to the ground staff.

385.title: PMC receives over 4,000 objections against draft electoral roll
385.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation received 4,273 objections against the draft electoral roll published last month. It had published the draft electoral roll on June 23 and sought suggestions and objections of voters by July 1, which was later pushed to July 3. The PMC stated that only those registered till May 31 this year were included in the electoral roll.

386.title: Australia ends requirement to declare vaccination status for international arrivals
386.article_body: Australia will not require international arrivals to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status from Wednesday (July 6) onwards, the country's government has announced. The restrictions on international arrivals were introduced in 2020 to control the spread of COVID-19. They have been removed now to reduce delays at airports, Australian Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said.

387.title: Alt News' Zubair taken to UP after new FIR over calling seers 'hate mongers'
387.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was brought to Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur by Delhi Police on Monday in connection with a new case registered against him for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. According to the FIR, Zubair had allegedly called Hindu seers Yati Narsinghanand Saraswati, Bajrang Muni, and Anand Swaroop "hate mongers" in his tweet dated May 27.

388.title: Pic shows 19-yr-old shooter Ankit posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala'
388.article_body: A picture showing 19-year-old shooter Ankit Sirsa posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala' before the singer was killed has surfaced online. Sirsa was arrested by Delhi Police over Moosewala's murder, with officers saying he was one of the shooters involved in the killing. Police said Sirsa was the "youngest shooter and most desperate" among those who shot Moosewala.

389.title: Madhubala begged Dilip Kumar to apologise to dad, he refused: Madhubala's sister
389.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said Madhubala and Dilip Kumar came close to tying the knot but it couldn't happen. "Had the court case not happened, Madhubala would've probably got married to Dilip Kumar. She...urged Dilip saab to apologise to our father," Madhu said. "[She asked him to] say...sorry for the sake of their relationship [but he] refused," she added.

390.title: RBI fines Kotak Mahindra Bank â‚¹1.05 cr, IndusInd Bank â‚¹1 cr for non-compliance
390.article_body: The RBI has imposed a monetary penalty of â‚¹1.05 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank for not following its directions on customer protection and loans and advances. The bank also failed to credit eligible amount to Depositor Education and Awareness Fund within the prescribed period. Further, IndusInd Bank has been fined â‚¹1 crore for its failure to adhere to KYC rules.

391.title: Feeling Adivasi woman can't become Prez depicts 'nasty mindset': BJP
391.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday criticised opposition candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, saying a feeling that an Adivasi woman is not capable of the position, depicts one's "nasty mindset". Murmu has already proved her capabilities, as the Governor of Jharkhand, as a minister and MLA in Odisha and as a lecturer in a college, he said.

392.title: Railways starts digital cloakrooms at KSR B'luru City & Cantt stations
392.article_body: The South Western Railway's Bengaluru division has started digital and smart cloakrooms at the KSR Bengaluru City and Bengaluru Cantonment railway stations. This project will generate non-fare revenue, officials said. "Passengers will be able to operate the lockers themselves using the KLOAK app and all operations including payments will be done online," an official stated.

393.title: Amit Shah spoke like broken gramophone at BJP event: T'gana minister
393.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke like a "broken gramophone" at BJP's recently-held national executive meeting in Hyderabad. "[BJP leaders] spoke about nothing except getting into power...It was disappointing that they didn't talk about any new welfare development," Rao added. Assembly elections in Telangana will be held in 2023.

394.title: U'khand panel for Uniform Civil Code holds first meeting in Delhi
394.article_body: The first meeting of the five-member draft committee for implementing the Uniform Civil Code in Uttarakhand met for the first time after its formation in May in New Delhi on Monday. The meeting was held under the chairmanship of retired SC Judge Ranjana Desai, who iterated that the second meeting will be held after a week.

395.title: Lost 2 of my kids, thought everything was over: Maha CM as he breaks down in Assembly
395.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde broke down in the state Assembly while remembering his two children who died in a boat tragedy in 2000. He said he was working as a Shiv Sena Corporator in Thane back then. "I lost two of my children and thought everything is over...I was broken but Anand Dighe Sahab convinced me to continue," Shinde said.

396.title: Aditya Chopra to make 2-hero actioner with Salman, SRK: Report
396.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra is planning to make a two-hero action film featuring Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan, reported Pinkvilla. The report quoted a source saying this will be "the first proper two-hero collaboration for the two" since 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. Salman and Shah Rukh will also be making cameos in each other's upcoming films 'Tiger 3' and 'Pathaan'.

397.title: The best I've ever seen in Tests: De Villiers on Pant-Jadeja's 222-run stand
397.article_body: Sharing his views on the ongoing fifth England-India Test, AB de Villiers said the "counterattack partnership" between Ravindra Jadeja and Rishabh Pant in the first innings is "the best" he has ever seen in Test cricket. Pant (146) and Jadeja (104) added a 222-run partnership for the sixth wicket. India scored 416 after being reduced to 98/5 at one stage.

398.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Delhi till Tuesday, orange alert for Wednesday
398.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Delhi till Tuesday and an orange alert for the city on Wednesday, with forecasts of moderate to heavy rainfall. The IMD has said that precipitation will continue in the city over the next six days. The onset of monsoon in Delhi was declared on June 30.

399.title: Federer is my greatest rival and I personally miss him: Nadal
399.article_body: Rafael Nadal said playing Wimbledon without his greatest rival and eight-time champion Roger Federer is a "negative thing". He added, "I personally miss him on the tennis tour and tennis of course miss him, tournaments, fans, everyone." Federer is absent from this year's Championships through knee injury, the first time he has skipped the tournament in 23 years.

400.title: Hotels, restaurants barred from levying service charge automatically or by default
400.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has issued guidelines barring hotels and restaurants from levying service charge automatically or by default in bills. Consumers cannot be forced to pay service charge and hotels and restaurants shall clearly inform them that it's voluntary, the guidelines stated. Further, service charge cannot be collected from consumers by any other name.
